This small subset of employees has been wronged. I believe one way to cushion this blow is to alter the severance equation as follows: 4 weeks X (number of employment years) 1 week X (each 10,000 of salary) Example one: 2 year employee with an $80,000 salary = 2*4+80/10 = 16 weeks severance Example two: 10 year employee with a $100,000 salary = 10*4+100/10 = 50 weeks severance This will accomplish two tasks, one is to skew the severance towards the longer term employees, the other is to reduce the total outlay so as not to overburden the company (since the group receiving the higher severance is small). I believe this is fair to both the employees and to our soon-to-be new management. Pls consider running this by management and or some focus groups, if in fact, the package is under review. Joe Phelan Sr.Director Enron Corporate Development EB
